## Last Verse
<!--Put a short poem you created using ChatGPT of 20 to 30 
lines,here!-->
In the realm where dreams take flight,  
A wondrous creature brings delight.  
With wings aglow, so soft and light,  
A fairy dances through the night.  

Her gown adorned in colors rare,  
With petals woven through her hair.  
Ethereal grace and gentle flair,  
She spreads enchantment everywhere.  

From dew-kissed meadows to moonlit glades,  
She weaves her magic in hidden shades.  
Whispers of secrets in woodland cascades,  
A guardian of nature's serenades.  

With each flutter of her delicate wings,  
She sprinkles stardust and joy she brings.  
Granting wishes and granting dreams,  
In her presence, life truly gleams.  

Through ancient forests and shimmering streams,  
The fairy glides, a vision it seems.  
Guardian of creatures, large and small,  
She watches over them, one and all.  

With mischief twinkling in her eyes,  
She enchants the world with sweet surprise.  
Her laughter rings like a lullaby,  
Echoing through the midnight sky.  

But heed her warning, oh mortal soul,  
Respect her realm and keep it whole.  
For fairies thrive where hearts are pure,  
In harmony with nature's allure.  

So let us cherish the fairy's grace,
And honor her magical embrace.
